data.text: @suru27 @ScientificInve6 No commodity shock either in the last 7 yrs

@suru27 I donot know why everyone is in so much hurry of buying..

People with patience and right knowledge have always got enough
Time to accumulate when the right time comes

2020 crash se bhi nhi seekhe to kuch nhi ho skta logo ka

@suru27 @ScientificInve6 Brilliant, thanks. Also Nifty PE looks to be touching COVID lows levels.
Would be interesting to see weekly A/D ratio line. Do you know where to find this data? Please share your insights.
@suru27 @ScientificInve6 Understood both the points, thanks for the details.

Take these indocators on one side, fundamental index valuation on other side, social media sentiment, buy sell data. Combine everything n some clarity emerges directionally than being in gut feel mode or being clueless. Rest no one knows shit about what will happen tomorrow

@xchintan @ScientificInve6 30 n 70 is usually oversopd n overbaught. With weekly time frame, 50% stocks hitting 30 is quite shitty. Don't look at exact nos, look at direction. Idea is not to predict exact point but be closer.

@xchintan @ScientificInve6 Never look at one parameter. If life was so easy then kya kehne. Even some of the advance ML models I tried with 8-9 significant variables driving model outcome had decent results but no where close to perfect with some false signals.

@Sakatas_Homma @ScientificInve6 Almost there n it has happened only 4 times. However, does not mean markets can reverse n start uptrend. It just says about slowing momentum of fall. However, medium term return (1-3 year) post those have been decent those who could buy panic. Need to see on 20 year history
@suru27 @ScientificInve6 well that's interesting. What made you plot this RSI<40 vs RSI>75 graph?  If pattern were to repeat, then we are close to bottom, is that a correct interpretation?
